title: Arpeggio: Diminished 7th in F# (Shape: A)
content:
# Arpeggio: Diminished 7th in F# (Shape: A)

An arpeggio is the playing of the notes of a chord in a sequence, rather than all at once. The Diminished 7th chord is made up of a root note, a minor third, a diminished fifth, and a diminished seventh above the root. When played as an arpeggio in the key of F# in shape A, the notes would be F# (root), A (minor third), C (diminished fifth), and E♭ (diminished seventh).

## Notes:
- F# (Root)
- A (Minor Third)
- C (Diminished Fifth)
- E♭ (Diminished Seventh)

## Genre and Flavor:
The Diminished 7th arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, classical, and some progressive rock music. It adds tension and dissonance to a piece, creating a unique and mysterious flavor.

## Three Songs:
1. "Caravan" by Duke Ellington 
2. "Clair de Lune" by Claude Debussy
3. "Pull Me Under" by Dream Theater
